headline: Search efforts paused as more flooding rains hit Central Texas - The Washington Post

headline: The biggest piece of Mars on Earth is going up for auction in New York - KSL News
description: For sale: a 54-pound rock. Estimated auction price: $2 million to $4 million. Why so expensive? It's the largest piece of Mars ever found on Earth.

headline: Weekly Injection Could Revolutionize Parkinson’s Treatment - Neuroscience News
description: Researchers have developed a long-acting weekly injection that delivers steady doses of levodopa and carbidopa, potentially transforming care for Parkinson’s disease.

headline: The Perseids are coming — here's how to watch the glorious meteor shower before the moon ruins the show - Live Science
description: As many as 100 "shooting stars" per hour can be visible, but a bright moon on the peak of the Perseids on Aug. 12 and 13 means evasive action is required.
